marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump says tariffs on Canada and Mexico will start next month
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump said that import tariffs on Canada and Mexico will begin next month, after being postponed for 30 days due to ongoing negotiations. Previously, the United States planned to impose a 25 percent import tariff on Canada and Mexico starting 4 February 2025. Trump also announced that retaliatory tariffs against countries that hinder US trade will start as early as April 2025. In mid-month, US Trade Secretary Howard Lutnick said that all studies related to retaliatory tariffs will be completed by 1 April 2025, allowing Trump to act immediately thereafter. Additionally, Trump ordered his cabinet to investigate the potential for import tariffs on copper commodities.

marketNews.title: Bloomberg reports China to inject at least 55 billion USD into Tier-1 banks
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the Chinese government plans to inject capital of at least 400 billion yuan (about 55 billion US dollars) into several Tier-1 banks, including Agricultural Bank of China Ltd. and Bank of Communications Co. Sources said the plan could be completed as early as the end of June 2025, although the exact amount for each bank is still being finalised. This move follows a stimulus package announced in 2024 to support the struggling economy.

marketNews.title: Wings Food launches Aquviva bottled water
marketNews.content: Wings Food launched a new packaged drinking water product under the brand Aquviva on Tuesday (25 February). The product will be released in PET bottles of 1,600 ml, 700 ml and 250 ml. Aquviva also plans to launch gallon packaging in the future.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Energy Ministry director says Minister will issue decree on coal export pricing
marketNews.content: Julian Ambassadur, Director at the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, said on Tuesday (25 February) that Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia will issue a Ministerial Decree on 1 March 2025 requiring coal exports to use the Coal Reference Price (HBA).

marketNews.title: President Prabowo launches Indonesia's first bullion bank
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto launched a bullion bank on Wednesday (26 February) that will provide gold storage services to help keep gold stocks within the country. He claimed that a bullion bank can help the nation save foreign exchange by keeping the entire gold supply chain domestic. Previously, the Financial Services Authority (OJK) approved operating permits for bullion banks for the subsidiaries of Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), PT Pegadaian, and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS), allowing them to offer financing, trading and gold storage services. Regulations require a financial institution to have at least 14 trillion rupiah in capital to become a bullion bank.

marketNews.title: Pertamina denies alleged blending of Pertalite into Pertamax
marketNews.content: Fadjar Santoso, Vice President of Corporate Communication at Pertamina, claimed on Tuesday (25 February) that the company ensures its products reaching the public meet specifications, following allegations that Pertamina blended Pertalite into Pertamax. He said that fuel specifications are regularly checked by the Oil and Gas Testing Center (Lemigas). The issue arose after the Head of the Legal Information Center of the Attorney General's Office, Harli Siregar, explained that a corruption case in a Pertamina subsidiary involved mixing RON 92 (equivalent to Pertamax) with RON 90 (equivalent to Pertalite) at Pertamina storage facilities. According to Fadjar, the case does not concern blending Pertalite into Pertamax, but rather the alleged purchase of RON 90 fuel that was then claimed as RON 92.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia to provide 130 trillion rupiah for 3 million houses program
marketNews.content: Hashim Djojohadikusumo, presidential adviser and brother of President Prabowo, said on Wednesday (26 February) that Bank Indonesia has agreed to provide 130 trillion rupiah to support a program to build three million houses per year. He did not detail the mechanism Bank Indonesia will use. Previously, Governor Perry Warjiyo said Bank Indonesia would purchase bonds for the housing program on the secondary market, without specifying the amount.

marketNews.title: 3 million houses program to start April 2025 with Qatar investment
marketNews.content: Hashim Djojohadikusumo announced on Wednesday (26 February) that the three-million-houses-per-year program will start in April 2025, together with an investment of about 18-20 billion US dollars from Qatar’s Qilaa International Group. He claimed the program has attracted investors from several countries, including China, the United Arab Emirates, India and Turkey.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo decides not to change PLN monopoly
marketNews.content: Hashim Djojohadikusumo said on Wednesday (26 February) that President Prabowo has decided not to alter the state electricity utility PLN’s monopoly in the domestic electricity market. Previously, during the presidential campaign, Prabowo considered ending PLN’s monopoly so that new renewable energy producers could sell directly to customers. Hashim’s statement came amid proposals by some members of parliament to include a power-wheeling scheme in the new renewable energy law, which would allow renewable producers to feed electricity into the PLN grid and sell directly to end-users. Hashim warned that if power-wheeling were implemented, the domestic electricity sector could become a ‘Wild West’ dominated by non-Indonesians.

marketNews.title: Indonesia expects Apple to sell iPhone 16 soon
marketNews.content: Indonesia’s Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, said on Wednesday (26 February) that Apple Inc. will soon be able to sell the iPhone 16 in Indonesia following agreements with the government, including the construction of a manufacturing plant and a research and development centre. He did not disclose the investment amount. Bloomberg reported that Apple will invest about 1 billion US dollars, which includes building an AirTag factory. Apple will soon obtain a domestic component certificate (TKDN), which is required for sales, though the timing of the certificate was not clarified.

tickerNews.title: INCO 2024: Net profit down 79% YoY, below expectations
tickerNews.content:
Vale Indonesia (INCO) reported a net profit of 7 million US dollars for 4Q24 (down 51.9% QoQ, down 81.6% YoY). This resulted in a 2024 net profit of 58 million US dollars (down 78.9% YoY), below expectations as it met only 87.7%/82.5% of the Stockbit/consensus estimate. Although 4Q24 revenue grew 5.2% QoQ, net profit fell mainly due to a 111.4% QoQ increase in operating expenses and other income turning into a loss of 4 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24 profit of 12 million US dollars).

- Increase in operating expenses and reversal of other income
The rise in operating expenses was driven by higher costs across all expense categories, which we estimate are related to the opening of new pits at Pomalaa and Bahodopi. The reversal of other income was mainly caused by the change from a gain on fair value accounting of derivative assets (related to additional participation rights in the HPAL smelter project) to a loss of 10 million US dollars (vs. 3Q24 gain of 9 million US dollars).

- Potential increase in nickel matte production and sales
INCO produced 18,528 tonnes of nickel matte in 4Q24 (up 2.9% QoQ), bringing total 2024 nickel matte production to 71,311 tonnes (up 0.8% YoY), slightly above the target of 70,805 tonnes. INCO may record higher nickel matte production and sales in the coming years as new pits at Pomalaa and Bahodopi come online. According to management guidance, INCO could add 1.7 million wet metric tonnes (wmt) of saprolite sales in 2025, consisting of 1.4 million wmt from Bahodopi and 300,000 wmt from Pomalaa. Previously, INCO did not sell saprolite nickel ore and only sold nickel in matte form.

Key Takeaway
We see INCO’s recovery outlook will be influenced by: 1) nickel price trends amid oversupply conditions; 2) the company’s efficiency efforts; and 3) sales volume growth from nickel ore contributions from the new Pomalaa and Bahodopi pits.

tickerNews.title: Prajogo Pangestu buys 1.5 million BREN shares
tickerNews.content: BREN: Barito Renewables Energy’s controlling shareholder, Prajogo Pangestu, purchased 1.5 million BREN shares at an average price of 6,272 rupiah per share on 25 February 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 9.4 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Prajogo Pangestu’s ownership in BREN increased from 0.09783% to 0.09896%.

tickerNews.title: United Tractors reports Komatsu equipment sales and coal production
tickerNews.content: UNTR: United Tractors recorded sales of 253 Komatsu heavy-equipment units in December 2024 (down 37% MoM, up 21% YoY). Cumulatively in 2024, Komatsu sales reached 4,420 units (down 16% YoY), achieving 101.6% of the 2024 target of 4,350 units, with a market share of 26% (vs. 27% in 11M24 and 29% in 2023). From the mining contractor segment, UNTR produced 148 million tonnes of coal in 2024 (up 15% YoY), with overburden removal of 1.22 billion cubic metres (up 5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PT Adikarsa Sarana buys ~2.3 billion EMTK shares
tickerNews.content: EMTK: Shareholder of Elang Mahkota Teknologi, PT Adikarsa Sarana, bought approximately 2.3 billion EMTK shares at an average price of 400 rupiah per share on 24 February 2025, which was 37.5% lower than the closing price of EMTK on the same day (640 rupiah per share). The total transaction value was 900 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Adikarsa Sarana’s ownership in EMTK increased from 10.43% to 14.09%. This transaction is part of the EMTK share-trading activity previously reported in Stockbit Snips on Monday (24/2).

tickerNews.title: Avia Avian reports Q4 2024 net profit
tickerNews.content: AVIA: Avia Avian posted a net profit of 504 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (up 0.41% YoY, up 43% QoQ). This resulted in a 2024 net profit of 1.7 trillion rupiah (up 1.35% YoY), equal to 103% of the consensus estimate. Sales grew to 2.1 trillion rupiah in 4Q24 (up 12% YoY, up 16% QoQ), making total 2024 sales 7.5 trillion rupiah (up 6.5% YoY). Gross profit margin was 45.3% in 4Q24 (down 340 basis points YoY, up 180 basis points QoQ) and 44.7% for the full year (down 7 basis points YoY). Operating expenses fell to 406 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (down 12% YoY, down 3.5% QoQ), although they increased 7.2% YoY over the whole year 2024.

tickerNews.title: PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa sells 23 million IMAS shares
tickerNews.content: IMAS: Shareholder of Indomobil Sukses Internasional, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa, sold 23 million IMAS shares at an average price of 493 rupiah per share on 18 February 2025. The total transaction value was approximately 11.3 billion rupiah, intended as a reverse repo. After this transaction, PT Sejahtera Raya Perkasa’s ownership in IMAS fell from 5.6% to 5.02%.

tickerNews.title: Uni-Charm Indonesia holds 4Q24 earnings call and reports profit decline
tickerNews.content: UCID: Uni-Charm Indonesia held its 4Q24 earnings call on Wednesday (26/2). The company attributed the 2024 revenue decline to: 1) price wars in the diaper segment leading to down-trading; and 2) reduced exports because Uni-Charm India now meets its domestic demand. UCID reported a net loss of 117 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (down 26% YoY versus 3Q24 net loss of 21 billion rupiah), resulting in a 2024 net profit of 350 billion rupiah (down 19.5% YoY). The 4Q24 loss was mainly due to stagnant revenue and lower operating margin. 4Q24 revenue was flat year-on-year at 2.5 trillion rupiah (up 19% QoQ), causing 2024 revenue to fall 5.6% YoY to 9.6 trillion rupiah. Operating margin fell to 5.6% (vs. 8% in 4Q23) while gross margin rose to 22% (vs. 21% in 4Q23) due to higher operating expenses, especially sales promotions and employee costs.

tickerNews.title: Cikarang Listrindo announces roadshow for US$500 million Singapore bond issuance
tickerNews.content: POWR: Cikarang Listrindo announced it will conduct a roadshow from 26 February to 4 March 2025 for the issuance of up to US$500 million of bonds on the Singapore Stock Exchange. POWR has appointed Barclays Bank plc, BNI Securities Pte. Ltd., and Deutsche Bank AG as joint bookrunners. The bond issuance was approved by the Board of Directors in November 2024 and is intended to refinance existing debt.

tickerNews.title: Robby Adijaya buys ~47.1 million WOWS shares
tickerNews.content: WOWS: Shareholder Ginting Jaya Energi, Robby Adijaya, purchased approximately 47.1 million WOWS shares at an average price of 50 rupiah per share between 27 December 2024 and 24 January 2025. The total transaction value was about 2.4 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Robby Adijaya’s ownership in WOWS increased from 6.78% to 8.68%.

tickerNews.title: TBS Energi Utama deputy director resigns
tickerNews.content: TOBA: Deputy Chief Executive Officer of TBS Energi Utama, Pandu Sjahrir, submitted his resignation from the company to become Chief Investment Officer at Danantara Investment Management. The resignation will be discussed at the upcoming shareholders’ meeting, but no date has been announced yet.
